Psychology_tweet_5_r$Psychology_275_p$Ps.text:
Finding A: My first, first author paper for my PhD 💃🎉🎊 Looking at the association between psychotic experiences (PE) & suicide. PE are important risk markers for future suicidal thoughts and behaviour. In future, let's ask about them!
Finding B: The results of study 3 replicate previous results by showing that ads identified as behaviorally targeted can affect consumer self-perceptions and hence behavior.
Finding C: The researchers say that the pain associated with circumcision in very young babies is likely to be more severe during the operation and post-operatively.
Finding D: Recent and established AMD and DR were associated with allcause dementia, and risks for DR were much larger (Supplementary Table 1 ).
Psychology_tweet_5_r$Psychology_275_p$Ps.displayed_text:
Finding A: My first, first author paper for my PhD 💃🎉🎊 Looking at the association between psychotic experiences (PE) & suicide. PE are important risk markers for future suicidal thoughts and behaviour. In future, let's ask about them!
Finding B: The results of study 3 replicate previous results by showing that ads identified as behaviorally targeted can affect consumer self-perceptions and hence behavior.
Finding C: The researchers say that the pain associated with circumcision in very young babies is likely to be more severe during the operation and post-operatively.
Finding D: Recent and established AMD and DR were associated with allcause dementia, and risks for DR were much larger (Supplementary Table 1 ).

Psychology_426_p$Psychology_25_r$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Heritability estimates for behavioral traits, typically between 30% and 50%, are by far the largest effect sizes in psychological science.
Finding B: The analysis showed that these functional connectivities underlie the relation between depressive problems and sleep quality.
Finding C: The results further indicate that while consumers recognize even inaccurate behaviorally targeted ads as implied social labels, it is accuracy (i.e., the match between this prior behavior and the implied label) that determines whether this label is perceived to be relevant to the self, leading to adjustments in self-perceptions that play a mediating role in subsequent trait-related behavior.
Finding D: Compared with the offspring of mothers aged 25 to 29 years, the offspring of mothers aged 12 to 19 years had a 51% increased risk of having a mental disorder (IRR, 1.51 [95% CI, 1.48-1.54]).

Finding A: Heritability estimates for behavioral traits, typically between 30% and 50%, are by far the largest effect sizes in psychological science.

Finding C: The results further indicate that while consumers recognize even inaccurate behaviorally targeted ads as implied social labels, it is accuracy (i.e., the match between this prior behavior and the implied label) that determines whether this label is perceived to be relevant to the self, leading to adjustments in self-perceptions that play a mediating role in subsequent trait-related behavior.
Finding D: Compared with the offspring of mothers aged 25 to 29 years, the offspring of mothers aged 12 to 19 years had a 51% increased risk of having a mental disorder (IRR, 1.51 [95% CI, 1.48-1.54]).

Psychology_tweet_92_p$Psychology_tweet_9.text:
Finding A: As with the missing circumcisions performed by religious circumcisers, such non-differential exposure misclassification will most likely produce conservative estimates of any real difference in ASD risk between circumcised and intact boys.
Finding B: Learning a lot about sleep from @username. Naps and sleep are very important for young children to enhance emotional memory. Even more reasons for a daytime siesta.
Finding C: Our results invite further investigation into the neurobiological mechanisms in ADHD that produce delays in development of large-scale networks.
Finding D: Nineteen percent of participants (n = 134) reported physical perpetration of dating violence, and more than one-half (68%) reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498, mean = 1.07, SD = 0.96).

Finding D: Nineteen percent of participants (n = 134) reported physical perpetration of dating violence, and more than one-half (68%) reported experiencing corporal punishment as children (n = 498, mean = 1.07, SD = 0.96).

Psychology_229_p$Psychology_239_r$Psycho.text:
Finding A: However, when memory was probed again following overnight sleep, the change in memory accuracy was greater if the child napped the previous day.
Finding B: While the advertising industry has been reluctant to tout its use of targeted ads because of privacy concerns, this research suggests there may be benefits for companies that indicate to consumers that they are sending ads meant specifically for them.
Finding C: Of the 95 participants with ASD, 78 per cent reported at least one occurrence of sexual victimization compared to 47.4 per cent of the 117 adults without ASD who participated in the study.
Finding D: Higher hazards were also observed for those in the second-highest quintile of index of multiple deprivation (HR = 1.62 [95% CI, 1.06-2.46]) compared with those in the lowest (least deprived) quintile.

Finding A: However, when memory was probed again following overnight sleep, the change in memory accuracy was greater if the child napped the previous day.
Finding B: While the advertising industry has been reluctant to tout its use of targeted ads because of privacy concerns, this research suggests there may be benefits for companies that indicate to consumers that they are sending ads meant specifically for them.
Finding C: Of the 95 participants with ASD, 78 per cent reported at least one occurrence of sexual victimization compared to 47.4 per cent of the 117 adults without ASD who participated in the study.
Finding D: Higher hazards were also observed for those in the second-highest quintile of index of multiple deprivation (HR = 1.62 [95% CI, 1.06-2.46]) compared with those in the lowest (least deprived) quintile.

Psychology_89_p$Psychology_503_r$Psychol.text:
Finding A: The finding that childhood corporal punishment was associated with perpetration of young adult physical dating violence, even after controlling for several demographic variables and childhood physical abuse, adds to the growing literature demonstrating deleterious outcomes associated with corporal punishment.
Finding B: While it\'s true that people are generally averse to harming others, the bottom line is that people don\'t feel this way all the time."
Finding C: Spanking alone does not teach children why their behavior was wrong or what they should do instead .
Finding D: Sociosexuality significantly predicted casual sex engagement after controlling for demographics, OR ¼ 2.06 [1.70, 2.49], p < .001; the interaction with gender was not significant, OR ¼ 1.13 [0.93, 1.36].

Finding A: The finding that childhood corporal punishment was associated with perpetration of young adult physical dating violence, even after controlling for several demographic variables and childhood physical abuse, adds to the growing literature demonstrating deleterious outcomes associated with corporal punishment.
Finding B: While it\'s true that people are generally averse to harming others, the bottom line is that people don\'t feel this way all the time."
Finding C: Spanking alone does not teach children why their behavior was wrong or what they should do instead .
Finding D: Sociosexuality significantly predicted casual sex engagement after controlling for demographics, OR ¼ 2.06 [1.70, 2.49], p < .001; the interaction with gender was not significant, OR ¼ 1.13 [0.93, 1.36].

Psychology_456_p$Psychology_147_p$Psycho.text:
Finding A: Practitioners who aim to facilitate effective goal setting in sport, business, and educational settings would benefit from guidelines for developing autonomous motivation.
Finding B: The results from study 1 provide support for the hypothesis that behaviorally targeted advertisements can act as implied social labels, resulting in adjustments to behavior consistent with the label.
Finding C: The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) .
Finding D: The researchers found functional connectivity between the areas of the brain associated with short-term memory, self, and negative emotions, which cause sufferers to dwell on bad thoughts and lead to a poor quality of sleep.

Finding B: The results from study 1 provide support for the hypothesis that behaviorally targeted advertisements can act as implied social labels, resulting in adjustments to behavior consistent with the label.
Finding C: The increased risk of ASD in circumcised boys under the age of 5 years was present among boys in both Muslim and non-Muslim families ( Table 2) .
Finding D: The researchers found functional connectivity between the areas of the brain associated with short-term memory, self, and negative emotions, which cause sufferers to dwell on bad thoughts and lead to a poor quality of sleep.

Psychology_448_r$Psychology_17_p$Psychol.text:
Finding A: They also found that while older bipolar disorder patients had significantly accelerated epigenetic aging compared to controls, no difference was found in younger patients.
Finding B: Circumcised boys in non-Muslim families were also more likely to develop hyperkinetic disorder (HR ¼ 1.81; 95% CI: 1.11-2.96).
Finding C: The researchers say another highlight of their work is finding that naps do contribute to emotion processing in preschool children, which is consistent with parents\' and early childhood teachers\' observations, though this benefit in emotional memory is delayed, say Spencer and colleagues.
Finding D: A total of 162 functional connectivity neural links involved in the areas of the brain associated with sleep were identified from these scans.

Psychology_tweet_230_r$Psychology_tweet_.text:
Finding A: It\'s not really manspreading. Expansive posture increases desirability consistent across gender. @username
Finding B: "‘Working is healthy; it keeps you young" Why older workers work beyond the retirement age - a qualitative study:
Finding C: "Marijuana abusers show lower positive and higher negative emotionality scores than controls, which is consistent, on one hand, with lower reward sensitivity and motivation and, on the other hand, with increased stress reactivity and irritability," researchers wrote in the study.
Finding D: Fathers\' implicit gender-role associations also uniquely predicted daughters\' (but not sons\') occupational preferences.
Psychology_tweet_230_r$Psychology_tweet_.displayed_text:
Finding A: It\'s not really manspreading. Expansive posture increases desirability consistent across gender. @username
Finding B: "‘Working is healthy; it keeps you young" Why older workers work beyond the retirement age - a qualitative study:
Finding C: "Marijuana abusers show lower positive and higher negative emotionality scores than controls, which is consistent, on one hand, with lower reward sensitivity and motivation and, on the other hand, with increased stress reactivity and irritability," researchers wrote in the study.
Finding D: Fathers\' implicit gender-role associations also uniquely predicted daughters\' (but not sons\') occupational preferences.
